CodecDevice::AudioDecoderParameters

CodecDevice::AudioDecoderParameters Struct Reference

#include <Apoxi/AddOns/CodecManager/CodecDevice.hpp>


Data Fields

CodecType m_audio_codec
INT m_format
UINT16 m_quality_level

Detailed Description

Audio decoder parameters passed to the decoder.
See also:
AudioDecoder::SetConfig

Field Documentation

CodecType CodecDevice::AudioDecoderParameters::m_audio_codec
 

Audio codec (if known to the caller) that shall be used for decoding. If the audio codec is not known to the caller, this parameter shall be set to CodecDevice::UnknownCodec or CodecDevice::DefaultCodec and the CodecManager shall find out the codec by querying all registered audio decoders (until the first decoder supporting the stream has been found). The same applies if the passed audio codec is not valid or the codec is not supported: all registered audio decoders shall be queried.

INT CodecDevice::AudioDecoderParameters::m_format
 

Audio codec format. This parameter is intepreted in different way dependending on the actual audio decoder. It has to be casted to the type specific for a given audio codec:
For AAC it has to be casted to AudioDecoder::AacFormatType enum.

UINT16 CodecDevice::AudioDecoderParameters::m_quality_level
 

Quality level of the decoder. The greater this value, the better the quality. 0 corresponds to default settings. If the value is greater than the maximum supported quality level (which can be retrieved via CodecManager::GetAudioDecoderCapabilities), the maximum level is set.
